title.rendered: Benefits Of Adding A Walk-In Shower To Your Vaughan Home

content.rendered:
As you consider home repair services in Vaughan, why not look into adding a walk-in shower? Typically made of glass and tile, this amenity can replace or work in addition to a bathtub. While tubs are a great place to relax after a long day, they’re not conducive to a quick rinse. A walk-in shower, on the other hand, allows you to hop in when you’re on a tight schedule.

So, is a walk-in shower right for you? To determine the answer, take a look at all the benefits of this modern bathroom feature.

Increases Accessibility

True to their name, walk-in showers don’t have a lip under the door. Instead, the floor gently slopes downward to encourage drainage without impeding movement. If you or a loved one struggles with mobility, a walk-in shower could decrease the risk of tripping and falling, allowing you to feel secure when you wash.

You can even find showers designed explicitly for maximum accessibility. There are plenty of options for wheelchair users and others who utilize mobility aids. Independence is essential for everyone, and the right shower can enable residents to look after their hygiene without assistance.

Decreases Cleaning Time

Let’s be honest—cleaning bathtubs can be a pain. The high lips mean you have to bend over to scrub, which is rough on your back and shoulders. Depending on the tub you have, you may also struggle to get into corners with your brush. When you’re done, you’re probably tired and sore.

In contrast, walk-in showers don’t require contortions during cleaning. You can easily stand while scrubbing grout, and many models are large enough to hold a chair if you get tired and need to sit. Depending on the condition of your shower, you can even use a scrub-free cleanser that eats away at grime then washes away with water alone.

If you have a traditional shower-bath combo, there’s an additional concern: shower curtains. These plastic barriers accumulate soap scum, hard water stains and even mould. They can also tear, forcing you to buy another one.

Walk-in showers don’t require a curtain since they come with doors. You can use glass cleaner on these and easily wipe away dirt, fingerprints and anything else you can think of.

Complements Any Bathroom

Do you have a small bathroom and worry that a walk-in shower won’t fit? The good news is that you get to decide the dimensions of your shower, ensuring it fits into your living space.

Additionally, you can choose your preferred ceramic tile or natural stone to complement your current decor. The possibilities are endless, and since most walk-in showers have glass doors, you get to enjoy your design choices to the fullest extent.

Adds More Space

Many shower stalls are just big enough to accommodate one person, making it difficult to maneuver. Walk-in showers, like walk-in closets, are all about space. You don’t have to worry about bumping into the showerhead, bumping your elbows on ledges or stubbing your toes on the lip. Instead, you get the freedom to truly enjoy your shower.

The custom nature of walk-in showers also means you can take advantage of wasted space. Tubs and showers with lips block you in, while lip-free showers give you those extra few inches for more breathing room. The expansive glass walls and doors also add to the sense of space, making them a great choice if you’re claustrophobic.
